newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Svyazinvest sale not seen limited to foreigners.
newsitem.headline: Svyazinvest sale not seen limited to foreigners.

text.p: Russia will sell a 25 percent stake in telecoms holding company Svyazinvest to the highest bidder and not limit the field to foreigners as announced earlier, a privatisation official said on Wednesday.
Sergei Molozhavy, head of the State Property Committee's methods administration, also told Reuters that the sale would happen no earlier than autumn.
"Why should we sell them (shares) only to foreigners?" he said. "We will sell it to whoever bids the most.
"We have potential buyers," he added, declining to identify the investors.
Molozhavy said Russia would wait for a better investment climate to sell the stake.

"Even if all questions (of the sale) are solved by the State Rights Administration (the presidential administration), it is smarter to sell Svyazinvest in autumn during increasing investment activity."

He said that he did not know if a presidential decree authorising sale of a total 49 percent stake in Svyazinvest and transfer of a controlling stake in international long distance carrier Rostelekom RTKM.RTS to Svyazinvest had been returned to the Property Committee for further work before issuing.
Communications Minister Vladimir Bulgak in January predicted that President Boris Yeltsin would sign the decree in February.
